markdown.markdown:
::: typewriter

Welcome!

::: I am a PhD student at Harvard University studying Health Policy and Decision Sciences. I am currently advised by Dr. Soroush Saghafian and work in [The Public Impact Analytics Science Lab (PIAS-Lab)](https://scholar.harvard.edu/saghafian/public-impact-analytics-science-lab-pias-lab-harvard) at Harvard. I also hold a research position in [Boston Children's Hospital](https://www.childrenshospital.org) General Pediatric Unit. I study the quantitative techniques that are used for informing decision-making at the individual and population levels, including decision analysis, risk analysis, cost-benefit and cost-effectiveness analysis, disease and policy simulation modeling, and behavioral decision theory. My research aims to quantify trade offs of harms versus benefits to directly inform a decision being made under conditions of uncertainty. Prior to starting my PhD, I completed an M.S. in Computational Analysis and Public Policy at The University of Chicago. Before that, I was a middle school mathematics teacher in New Haven, CT. Aside from research I am very interested in K-12 computer science education. \hline **What am I currently listening to?** [![](https://spotify-github-profile.vercel.app/api/view?uid=22pabhxtridwheejz7rfec6fq&cover_image=true&theme=novatorem&show_offline=false&background_color=121212&interchange=false&bar_color=53b14f&bar_color_cover=true)](https://spotify-github-profile.vercel.app/api/view?uid=22pabhxtridwheejz7rfec6fq&redirect=true)
